title: Abila Named Cloud Top 500 Applications Vendor By Apps Run The World
text:
Abila
AUSTIN, Texas , Oct. 6, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Abila , the leading provider of software and services to associations, nonprofits, and government entities, was recently named a Cloud Top 500 Applications Vendor by Apps Run The World . Ranked 159th on the list, Abila was also identified as one of the top two cloud companies focused on the nonprofit sector. The annual report identifies companies that are leading the way in cloud services and solutions.
"I would like to commend Abila for becoming part of Cloud Top 500 in our annual Apps Run The World Survey," said Albert Pang , president of Apps Run The World. "Leveraging the ubiquity of the cloud, Abila has made great strides in cloud-based fund accounting applications with innovative products, and is reshaping the overall software sector for nonprofits and associations."
Each year, Apps Run The World ranks the largest cloud applications vendors in the world, based on their cloud subscription revenues. According to Apps Run The World, as the cloud market continues to grow and mature, coupled with robust customer demand, more agile, user-friendly applications will be readily available to a wide range of organizations across a wide range of verticals to achieve better outcomes. For nonprofits and associations, this includes accounting, fundraising, and donor and member management.
Abila's cloud-based offerings include Abila MIP Advance™, offering true fund accounting™ in the cloud; Abila netFORUM Enterprise™; Abila netFORUM Pro™; and Freestone™ Learning Management System (by Peach New Media, an Abila company). These solutions provide member management and engagement and continuing education for associations. Our other cloud-based solutions include Abila Elevate™, Abila Fundraising 50™, and Abila Fundraising Online™ that provide comprehensive donor management and online fundraising capabilities to nonprofits.
"We are proud to be recognized as an innovator and leader in cloud services and solutions; and for taking the lead in helping nonprofits, associations, and government entities successfully transition to the cloud," said Erin Shy , senior vice president of product development for Abila. "As part of our ongoing commitment to our customers and to the market, we are continually exploring ways to provide the best possible technology by the most useful means to ensure we're enabling our customers to be truly successful."
About Abila
Abila is the leading provider of software and services to associations and nonprofit organizations that help them improve decision making, execute with greater precision, increase engagement, and generate more revenue. With Abila solutions, association and nonprofit professionals can use data and personal insight to improve financial and strategic decision making, enhance member and donor engagement and value, operate more efficiently and effectively, and increase revenue to better activate their mission. Abila combines decades of industry insight with technology know-how to serve more than 8,000 customers across North America . For more information, please visit www.abila.com .
